Philip`, the objective is not to maximize "the prevalence of alt", it is to maximize the average accessibility of an image on the Web.
And showing alt= as a tooltip has given many people the wrong idea about how to author it.
Hixie: yt?
There's some discussion of Steve's alt research on WSG as well http://www.mail-archive.com/wsgâŠ™wo/msg30500.html
jgraham: <pre> and <textarea> should have a LF added in the innerHTML view
"<pre>x" should become: "<html><head></head><body><pre>
x"
jgraham: also, the "View In Browser" paragraph should be moved to the Parse Tree section, since it will build the tree parsed by html5lib, not parse the serialized innerHTML
jgraham: finally :) it would be nice if Input Document was in a textarea with a submit button so you can modify the input without having to go back
zcorpan: Try that
